result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roberto David Mendez Jr

records.addlTxt: Court ordered INCREASE of cash bail in amount of $7,000.00. Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  All other conditions previously ordered remain in effect.

Defendant Roberto David Mendez Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Roberto David Mendez Jr.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for a return on warrant.  Arguments heard as to bail. Court ordered INCREASE of cash bail in amount of $7,000.00, for total of $10,000.00. Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  All other conditions previously ordered remain in effect.  Court sets the case over for Scheduling conference in Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court in receipt of a warrant regarding this defendant. Court contacted the parties via email correspondence to notify them of the return on warrant hearing. Return on Warrant hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 8:30 am in Br. 9.

Bench Warrant Cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 10/24/2022. Original (Copy) bench warrant scanned. Case is adjourned for Return of Bench Warrant in Branch 9.  Notice is given to Public Defender and District Attorney.

Defendant Roberto David Mendez Jr not in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly not in court.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court to address recent Justice Point Violation. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

The Court INCREASES Justice Point SUPERVISION to Level 5.  Court ORDERS absolute sobriety. Court ORDERS defendant to undergo  random urine screens, drug tests and breathalyzer test. All other conditions previously ordered remain the same.

Defendant Roberto David Mendez Jr in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Roberto David Mendez Jr.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Calendar Call. Court cancels previously stayed warrant.  The Court takes no action as to bail. The Court INCREASES Justice Point Supervision to Level 5, with conditions. 

Discussion held. Possible global resolution with misdemeanor case pending before Br. 40 (Case No. 21CM3462). Matter adjourned for further Status conference to allow time to review resolution and determine course of action.  Case adjourned to Br. 9. Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roberto David Mendez Jr not in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Roberto David Mendez Jr.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond Hearing. State requests Bench Warrant be issued; Defense requests additional time given circumstances that Defendant recently posted bail.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case adjourned to Br. 9. Calendar call scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Roberto David Mendez in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Roberto David Mendez in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Roberto David Mendez appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer T. Vue. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 09.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Roberto David Mendez in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Roberto David Mendez in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Roberto David Mendez appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 09. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
